intro: Echium philothei, commonly known as the Greek thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Echium philothei is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a hardy and resilient species. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
